title: Ticket #5127: make condor_userprio -long output easier to process
description:
The userprio ad that is returned from the negotiator is very hard to work with because it's one big ad that is logically multiple ads where attributes that end in a common integer refer to the same group/user information.

For instance, if there a two users, the ad might look like this 

  Name1 = "foo"
  Priority1 = 10
  Name2 = "bar"
  Priority2 = 12

And would be processed by condor_userprio as if it were really this 

  Id = 1
  Name = "foo"
  Priority = 10

  Id = 2
  Name = "bar"
  Priority = 12

We should change the negotiator to return the second form rather than the first, but in the mean time (and for backward compatibility). The usefulness of condor_userprio -long could be enhanced by having it convert from the first form to the second on the fly. This would allow the addition of -af and -constraint arguments in condor_userprio.
remarks:
2015-Jul-02 09:36:43 by johnkn:
This commit adds arguments -legacy and -modular as modifiers to -long. also -autoformat (-af) which implies -modular.

-legacy forces the old form of -long, which is one ad for all userprio information with attribute names having an integer appended to indicate which record. -modular is the improved form, where there is one ad per record. -af operates on, (and therefore forces) the modular form.

in the modular form, the first ad contains only 2 attributes: 

    NumSubmittors = 23
    LastUpdate = 1435304615

NumSubmittors indicates how many subsequent ads there will be, these ads will be either group records or submittor records. In the current implementation, the group records will be first, followed by the submittor records with the <none> group being the first group. Groups have these attributes. 

    SubmittorId = 2
    IsAccountingGroup = true
    Name = "alice"
    SurplusPolicy = "regroup"
    GroupSortKey = 0.0
    EffectiveQuota = 1.8084
    ConfigQuota = 0.0548
    SubtreeQuota = 1.8084
    Requested = 0.0
    AccountingGroup = "<none>"
    Priority = 50000.0
    PriorityFactor = 100000.0
    BeginUsageTime = 0
    ResourcesUsed = 0
    LastUsageTime = 0
    AccumulatedUsage = 0.0
    WeightedAccumulatedUsage = 0.0
    WeightedResourcesUsed = 0.0

And submittors have these attributes, this is the same as the above except for the 6 attributes listed above after Name and before AccountingGroup. 

    SubmittorId = 17
    IsAccountingGroup = false
    Name = "bob@submit-3.chtc.wisc.edu"
    AccountingGroup = "<none>"
    Priority = 50000.0
    PriorityFactor = 100000.0
    BeginUsageTime = 0
    ResourcesUsed = 0
    LastUsageTime = 0
    AccumulatedUsage = 0.0
    WeightedResourcesUsed = 0.0
    WeightedAccumulatedUsage = 0.0
